title: Learning rate not updating as it should - efficientnets

labels.name: howtousedlc
labels.description: issue regarding the use of DeepLabCut

body:
Hi,
So, we managed to run the efficientnet-b6 model in ticket #1144 on an NVIDIA A100 GPU (40GB mem), instead of a P100. A resnet_152 model was previously trained with the same training parameters as below, properly. However, switching to the efficientnet-b6, it seems that the default learning rate of 0.0005 is not being updated as it should, and hence the loss seems to be on an extremely slow converging path (see output below)!

Any suggestion on what parameter to amend, please?

Thanks :-) 

--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Training parameters
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
'alpha_r': 0.02,
 'batch_size': 1,
 'crop_pad': 0,
 'cropratio': 0.4,
 'dataset_type': 'imgaug',
 'decay_steps': 30000,
 'deterministic': False,
 'display_iters': 1000,
 'fg_fraction': 0.25,
 'global_scale': 0.8,
 'intermediate_supervision': False,
 'intermediate_supervision_layer': 12,
 'location_refinement': True,
 'locref_huber_loss': True,
 'locref_loss_weight': 0.05,
 'locref_stdev': 7.2801,
 'log_dir': 'log',
 'lr_init': 0.0005,
 'max_input_size': 1500,
 'mean_pixel': [123.68, 116.779, 103.939],
 'min_input_size': 64,
 'mirror': False,
 'multi_step': [[0.005, 10000],
                [0.02, 430000],
                [0.002, 730000],
                [0.001, 1030000]],
 'net_type': 'efficientnet-b6',
 'num_joints': 12,
 'optimizer': 'sgd',
 'pairwise_huber_loss': False,
 'pairwise_predict': False,
 'partaffinityfield_predict': False,
 'pos_dist_thresh': 17,
 'regularize': False,
 'rotation': 25,
 'rotratio': 0.4,
 'save_iters': 50000,
 'scale_jitter_lo': 0.5,
 'scale_jitter_up': 1.25,
 'scoremap_dir': 'test',
 'shuffle': True,
 'stride': 8.0,
 'weigh_negatives': False,
 'weigh_only_present_joints': False,
 'weigh_part_predictions': False,
 'weight_decay': 0.0001}
